title: Who was the first person to go to the South Pole? - Quora

response.answer_text: A Norwegian named Roald Engelbregt Gravning Amundsen led an expedition to the South Pole in 1910/1911. He and his team (Helmer Hanssen, Sverre Hassel and Oscar Wisting ) reached the geographic South Pole on 14 December 1911. The British expedition led by Robert Falcon Scott reached the South Pole on 17 January 1912 found messages left by Amundsen’s team and perished on the return trip to their base.

The first expedition to reach the geographic South Pole was led by the Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen. The Search Engine Google is showing this animated Doodle in many Countries for the 105th Anniversary of First Expedition to Reach the South Pole.
